I'll have to work on it again with the server down. X-tras are done - there is a field in maintenance to make the ToDo scripts active. Catherine

field.data: Susan, if you look on the weekly in/out times it shows Scott worked 3.99 hours on 7/1. When you look on his timecard it shows that he worked 3.99 hours and then 3.53 after his break. So, the total should be 7.52 but this is not reflected in the in/out times. I ran a test payroll for 7/1 and the report pulls the total amount of 7.52 hours. However, I don't want this to be the source for any potential erros. Can you look at this? Hartmut

field.name: MemoText
field.data: Hartmut, I did speak with Amanda and she wanted Rosario to spend time in the rooms. I told Rosario until 3:30 because Amanda was gone. I asked Amanda today about Rosario not finishing something for her and she seemed mystified and could not remember. Amanda tried to meet with the 2 gals today today for an hour and a half while I took the phone so she could test them, but never got the chance. We should discuss a firm time for Thurs. and Fri. when they are going to be quizzed, etc. or it never happens due to guest demands. Susan Hi Susan, you are welcome to send reservations fixes to everyone. It does not seem to work that I can be the only messenger. The other thing is that Amanda has clear instructions on how to get Rosario and Anna up to speed. Amanda had asked Rosario to work on something which she ended up not doing because you asked her to go to rooms. Maybe it would be an option to ask Amanda first if she has either one of them working on something in particular. That way there is also some sort of communication and consideration. Hartmut

field.name: MemoText
field.data: 1) Your cookies on Wed. were great. Looked good and tasted good. Please use the larger scoop so the cookie are generously sized. Ask Roberta which one she uses. 2) The chocolate chip cookies on Tues. tasted off. Amanda, Diane and I tested them on Wed. and they had no flavor. Seems like maybe vanilla or something was missing. Not enough chocolate chips, either. 3) You should plan on 1 1/2 cookies per person in house for that evening. 4) If anything does not come out (inc breakfast items) you need to re-do. We know you are still learning but we need to be consistent with our quality every day. Susan and Ed

field.name: MemoText
field.data: 1) We threw away about 20+ of the chocolate/ginger cookies from this weekend. They were all soft and crumbly and the guests did not eat them. This seems to be typical for this cookie. 2) The peanut butter cookie from last night, same thing. About 24 are left over. They are dry, some are overcooked. 3) With full houses we typically have 0 cookies leftover so guests are passing these by. 4) Please eliminate these recipes and stick with the tried and true ones until we can find some real winners. The brownies, Heather's cookies and the chocolate chip cookies are good recipes. The lemon cookies when made correctly with lots of lemon zest are also delicious and popular. 5) I purchased some really delicious ginger cookies from Whole Foods. Our taste test with Laila, Brett, JR and me is that they are worthy of duplication. I will be in on Tues. morning when you are baking to give you a sample.

field.name: MemoText
field.data: Marilyn, I purchased 12 bottles of Laura Scudder natural peanut butter for you from Walmart. Each is 16 oz. and they were only $2.78 each. Also, I purchased 20 Kerns mango nectar. They were .$55 each with CRV instead of the comparable of $.90 at Nob Hill. Also, I purchased a Wilton fluted, individual bundt (muffin size) pan and will test at home to see how well it works. I was thinking that if the flutes are Pam-sprayed well, the result would appear very attractive and would end up using less dough per serving since they are served bottom up and would not need a mounded top. I will put the receipts in your box today. Susan

field.name: MemoText
field.data: Brett, Last night at 10:15pm Margo called stating that the guests in Chautauqua did not have anything but hot water in their shower again. She reported that they said they had not had a shower now for 2 days? Margo called Ed. Ed told her to move the guests to Mariposa. Margo called back at about 10:30pm and said that the keys that she had did not open the MAR. JR went back to the Inn after arriving home at 9:30pm and opened MAR door. The guests are unable to move to MAR because she is somewhat handicapped and and cannot stay in the room but they will use the shower. When you reported yesterday that the shower was working, did you test it and were you able to adjust the water temperature? I made sure last night that the valves in the kitchen were in the correct position. First, as soon as you arrive today you need to take the sleepover keys and make sure they work in ALL the rooms at the Inn. Second, show Margo tonight how to open the doors in the BH. Thanks. Susan

field.name: MemoKeyMaster
field.data: rd Brett rd SusanF rd JR rd Ed rd Laila

field.name: MemoText
field.data: 3/26 Refunded them for 1 full night of their stay in addition to the $66 that we refunded them upon check-out. Sent new confirmation plus the following e-mail. Dear Ms. Luong, We apologize again for the problems that you encountered during your stay in the Chautauqua room. In case it was not communicated to you and your companion, we took the valve in your shower apart on Tuesday afternoon after you reported the problem with the cold water late Monday evening, tested the water temperature and everything was working correctly. Unfortunately, late Tuesday evening you experienced the same problem with the result that we offered to move you to the Mariposa room on the second floor. Normally the rate in the Chautauqua room is $239 per night but for your stay you booked at the Winter Rate of $199. Upon check-out on Wednesday we gave you a refund of $66 resulting in a rate of $169 per night for the Chautauqua. After you checked out on Wednesday we took the plumbing apart 2 more frustrating times before we found that the culprit was a hard piece of gunk that was intermittently clogging the cold water input. Since our plumbing in the Beach House building is fairly new, it is a total mystery how it came to be lodged in the pipes! We have given you a full refund for one of the nights of your stay or an additional $152.90 which was credited to your card today and the confirmation was sent to your e-mail address. Again, our apologies for the problems during your stay and we hope to have you stay with us again. Sincerely, Susan Wheelwright Proprietor

field.name: MemoText

Margo called back at about 10:30pm and said that the keys that she had did not open the MAR. JR went back to the Inn after arriving home at 9:30pm and opened MAR door. The guests are unable to move to MAR because she is somewhat handicapped and and cannot stay in the room but they will use the shower. When you reported yesterday that the shower was working, did you test it and were you able to adjust the water temperature? I made sure last night that the valves in the kitchen were in the correct position. First, as soon as you arrive today you need to take the sleepover keys and make sure they work in ALL the rooms at the Inn. Second, show Margo tonight how to open the doors in the BH. Thanks. Susan

field.name: MemoText
field.data: Brett I responded to Cindy the TA's very testy last e-mail. You will see it in the iin-box. Brett, you absolutely MUST bcc me on all emails that you send out. I always receive bccs from Beth and Laila but never from you. Susan

field.name: MemoText
field.data: Laura, The red coated Gouda served today is really awful. 3 of us ate it and then spit it out (me, Beth, Laila). Please test it and see if it is OK. If not, talk to Chuck and get a return. If it is, let's use it for cooking and purchase no more. Thanks. Susan cc: Ryan and Managers

I will need to review with each of you how this is working in the res system and what you can expect to see when you are reviewing Internet bookings. This will take about 15-20 minutes. You can start by looking at the reservation that has my name on it that I tested today. Susan
